resources.string: PC Assembly and Disassembly Mobile App
1. The vast majority of today’s consumer motherboards come in one of three sizes: ATX, Micro-ATX and ______.
2. When was the ATX (Advanced Technology eXtended) motherboard and power supply configuration specification developed by Intel?
3. ______ is a standard for motherboards that was introduced in December 1997.
1. What is the main and most important components you will find on the motherboard?
2. A chipset is a smaller set of chips that has replaced a larger amount of chips.
3. The _______ chip was known because it was located at the top portion of the motherboard. The chip was directly connected to the CPU and acted as a communication middleman for systems.
1. The availability of 16GB Modules means you can install 32 GB of RAM even the tiny Mini-ITX board.
2. One thing to know about USB port is that color is consistent.
3. Mini-ITX motherboards are usually limited to ______ RAM slots due to board space constraints.
4. Most modern ATX motherboards have a maximum of _____ PCI or PCI-Express expansion slots.
5. Who developed the Mini-ITX with 17 x 17 cm (6.7 x 6.7 in) motherboard in 2001?
6. Among the choices below who has the largest format of the bunch, measuring of 305x244 mm?
7. What is the advantage of having an EATX motherboard?
8. The _______ typically implements the slower capabilities of the motherboard in a chipset computer architecture.
9. Through the use of chipset integrated channel circuitry, the Northbridge can directly link signals from I/O units to the CPU for data control and access.
10. A _____ is simply two pairs of wired connections one pair sends data, the other receives data.
1. In what part of the system unit you can find various connectors for the many other devices in your computer system?
2. This thing is where the PC plugs into a cord that plugs into the wall.
3. Air gets sucked in here, blows around inside the console to keep things cool and then puffs out the vents.
1. _______ were highly sought after by businesses because of their ability to offer significant power and features.
2. The _____ also integrates versatile I/O and supports low energy consumption and finless operations.
3. This case was released in 2008 to provide even greater flexibility to a wide range of user requirements?
1. These slots are available for adding new components to the console and expanding your PC’s hardware.
2. It’s where you plug in the PC’s electrical power cord?
3. These 9-pin connector is one of the oldest and most universal port found in the back of a PC?
4. This unique three-row, 15-pin connector is where the monitor connects to the system unit?
5. Also known as a joystick port, this 15-pin connector can be used for both joysticks and for MIDI musical devices?
6. It is sometimes referred to as an internet connector?
7. This is one of the most affordable case sizes because of its simple design and need for fewer materials?
8. It represents a viable solution as they can hold larger EATX and SSI CEB server boards and are suitable for overclocking?
9. Also known as a joystick port, this 15-pin connector can be used for both joysticks and for MIDI musical devices?
10. The _____ also integrates versatile I/O and supports low energy consumption and finless operations.
1. Make sure your hands are not dry to avoid damaging any mechanical parts as well to avoid electrocution.
2. Use only rubber shoes when standing on the ground or in a concrete floor.
3. Prepare a wooden table or plastic to put all your parts/Components.
1. Hold the components by edges and touch the IC’s
2. If component does not come out easily, forcefully remove it.
3. The three of the most damaging things to a computer are moisture, shock and dust.
1. Make sure no parts are missing and make sure all of it is properly installed.
2. Make sure all screws are properly installed at their places.
3. Return all your tools in proper place.
1. Work in a cool area to avoid perspiration.
2. Use metal to place your components.
3. When removing any cables, wires or ribbons, make sure to grasp the wire at the base or head to keep it from breaking.
4. Make sure your hands are not dry to avoid damaging any mechanical parts as well to avoid electrocution.
5. Use only rubber shoes when standing on the ground or in a concrete floor.
6. Prepare a wooden table or plastic to put all your parts/Components.
7. Hold the components by edges and touch the IC’s
8. If component does not come out easily, forcefully remove it.
9. The three of the most damaging things to a computer are moisture, shock and dust.
10. Make sure no parts are missing and make sure all of it are properly installed.
2. ____ is the best tool used when rubbing down computer components.
3. Do not use vacuum that plugs into the walls since it creates lots of _________ that can damage your computer?
1. In the choices below select the answer that describes the symptoms of a RAM Problem.
2. ______ errors are annoying because you don’t even have a chance to read the error message.
3. If all the memory modules appear bad, then the problem is likely with the memory slot itself.
Blow off any loose dust or debris from the RAM using canned air.
Blow out the empty RAM bay with canned air.
Files particularly once you frequently access and save seem to be inexplicably corrupted.
1. In the choices below it shows the typical symptoms of failing PSU except one.
2. In the choices below it shows SWAP Testing except one.
3. In the choices below it doesn’t show typical symptoms of a failing PSU except one.
PC won’t start but your case fans spin.
A blue screen with white text flashes before restarting.
Try a different power cable and wall socket to make sure neither is dead.
Place the spare next to your PC and connect the motherboard, external GPU.
Plug the spare PSU into the wall and test.
Hearing beeping sound from the PC.
Extra noise coming from the PC case.
1. From video games to professional 3D work, a ______ is an essential piece of kit for those who want to push their computers to the next level of graphics rendering.
2. In this case you won’t see any visual clues at all. A graphics card gone badly can simply decide to stop working and not display anything.
3. What is the best thing to do when your graphics card is experiencing issues due to overheating?
1. Getting a ____________ on your computer does not automatically means a motherboard issue. A lot of times the main reason may be a bad driver o hardware failure.
2. _______ is basically diagnostic test run by your motherboard’s BIOS to check if peripherals like hard drives, video card, RAM or keyboard, or mouse are all connected or not.
3. Below are the general symptoms of bad hard drive except one.
Random Lock ups or Freezing Issues

2. ______ is one of the best entertainment that PC Users can appreciate more than anyone else?

1. Hardware tools are grouped into four categories. In the choice below which answer shows the right grouped?
2. This kind of EDS Tools protects computer equipment when grounded?
3. This kind of hand tools used to tighten or loosen screws that have a star-like depression on the top, a feature that is mainly found on laptops?
EDS tools, Hand tools and Cleaning Tools
Drill tools, Spanner Tools and Clamp Tools
Wrenches tools, Pliers Tools and Hammer Tools
1. The purpose of self-grounding or wearing an antistatic wrist strap is to equalize the electrical charge between you and the equipment.
2. The antistatic wrist strap is a conductor that cannot connects in your body to the equipment or ground channels the electricity through the wire that connects the strap.
3. How many parts that a wrist trap have?
1. This kind of tools is used to remove the insulation from wire so that it can be twisted to other wires or crimped to connectors to make a cable?
2. This kind of tools used to tighten or loosen slotted screws?
3. This kind of tools used to hold small parts?
4. This kind of hand tools used to tighten or loosen nuts in the same way that a screwdriver tightens or loosen screws (sometimes called a nut driver).
5. This kind of tool used to terminate were into termination blocks. Some cable connectors must be connected to cables using a punch down tool.
6. This kind of cleaning tool used to blow away dust and debris from different computer parts without touching the components?
7. This kind of cleaning tool used to screws, jumpers, fasteners, and other small parts and prevents them from getting mixed together?
8. How many parts that a wrist trap have?
9. Turn the screwdriver _______ to tighten the screw.
10. Turn the screwdriver _______ to loosen the screw.
